item.title: Final Fantasy 14 Will Begin Rolling Out Major Fan-Requested Changes This Month
item.description:
Final Fantasy 14 producer and director Naoki Yoshida announced that two previously-revealed changes to the Forked Tower raid will be implemented a month earlier than expected, as players will be able to queue in as a pre-made 48-player alliance starting July 3. Additionally, Final Fantasy 14 will change the spawn rate for the auroral mirages' weather effect to happen more frequently, which is needed to enter the Forked Tower.

During the 87th Letter from the Producer LIVE, Yoshida spent the first segment of the broadcast addressing FF14 player feedback about the Occult Crescent field operation and Cosmic Exploration. Yoshida noted that changes would be coming in Patch 7.3 to address the feedback, and the update is slated to arrive in early August. Yoshida stated that some of the suggestions players made will carry over into future iterations of the Occult Crescent and Cosmic Exploration in Dawntrail 's remaining patches throughout 2025 and 2026.

However, two of the changes originally slated for Final Fantasy 14 's 7.3 update will be made sooner than expected. According to a Lodestone post by Yoshida, players can enter the Occult Crescent as a pre-formed alliance of up to 48 players starting July 3. However, the change will require four hours of emergency server maintenance in the early hours of July 3, at 2:00 AM Eastern. The auroral mirages weather effect, which is required to enter the Forked Tower raid, will also spawn sooner than before when a new Occult Crescent instance is created. These two changes will make it easier for players looking to clear the Forked Tower for rewards like the Demon Haul mount to do so.

Final Fantasy 14 Making Forked Tower Changes Ahead of Patch 7.3

  • Starting July 3, players can enter the Occult Crescent as a pre-formed alliance of up to 48 players.
  • The auroral mirages weather effect needed to enter the Forked Tower raid will appear sooner than before.
  • These changes were originally slated to arrive in early August alongside Patch 7.3.
  • Further changes are still planned for the 7.3 update, including exclusive instance access for pre-formed alliances.

Yoshida stressed that the changes would not impact Patch 7.3's early August release, as most of the work on Dawntrail' s climactic patch has been completed. Three additional updates to the Occult Crescent are still slated to launch in Final Fantasy 14 's upcoming patch. Namely, the amount of sanguine ciphers contributed will be easier to see on the user interface, and auroral mirages will not overlap with critical engagements. Yoshida also listed another change not covered in the 87th Live Letter that will grant pre-formed parties exclusive access to an Occult Crescent instance for a set time before random players can join in.

Though Final Fantasy 14 players have expressed their growing discontent with the current state of the game, the quick turnaround to implement these changes is not a common thing. Only time will tell if the changes are a sign of things to come from Square Enix.

item.title: July 10 is Going to Be a Big or Bad Day For The Sims 4 Fans
item.description:
Fans of the life-simulation genre have been treated to an abundance of new releases this summer, and now it’s The Sims 4’s turn to shine with its latest expansion. Enchanted by Nature releases on July 10, and thereafter, players will be immersed in a magical world filled with fantasy elements. This latest Expansion Pack for The Sims 4 introduces fairies as a new life state and features a range of eco-friendly content—gameplay elements that players have long sought after.

With the Enchanted by Nature DLC on the cusp of its release, The Sims 4 fans are teeming with pre-launch enthusiasm. However, a cloud looms over the fandom, infusing what could be celebratory glee with just a hint of worry. And for a specific part of The Sims 4 ’s playerbase who have been first-hand witnesses of DLC launches, this worry is actually dread. The release of Enchanted by Nature will be a big or bad day for The Sims 4 fans, and it seems to be a tale as old as the game itself.

The Sims 4’s Enchanted By Nature Release Date: The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly

It’s pretty rare for the launch date of a major game’s DLC to stir such mixed feelings among players. Typically, new DLC for a game like The Sims 4 generates excitement within the fanbase, as players look forward to new content, features, and gameplay enhancements. However, Maxis has shown time and again that The Sims is an unusual franchise in many ways. These concerns and causes for celebration about Enchanted by Nature can be best summarized with the theatrics of a three-act play: the good, the bad, and the ugly.

The Good: July 10 is a Big Day for Fans of Green and Supernatural Content

Enchanted by Nature is jam-packed with content that the fan base has been waiting on for years. Enchanted by Nature’s confirmed features include game-changers such as a new fairy life state, an apothecary skill, a luck stat, whimsical build mode items, and the opportunity to truly live off the land. For fans who wanted just a little more from the Eco Lifestyles Expansion Pack, Enchanted by Nature is here to answer the call with just a touch of the fantastical.

The Sims as a franchise has never shied away from out-of-the-box thinking. The Sims ’ weirdest DLC packs have actually been some of its most successful, both critically and in terms of fandom reception. Enchanted by Nature appears to fall into this tradition, where going unconventional has led to increased hype. Of course, DLC like the Parenthood Game Pack and the Seasons Expansion Pack have been lauded as some of The Sims 4 ’s best due to their realistic content—but there is a unique spark across The Sims fans that is only ignited when Maxis goes full-on strange.

The Bad: Bugs Are The Norm, Not the Exception

The Sims franchise is notorious for many reasons. From its true sandbox beauty to its chaotic gameplay, the reigning monarch of the life-sim genre has steadily worked its way to the throne. However, bugs are also another factor it is known for. The Sims 4 i s full of weird glitches and bugs that both provide a hilarious diversion from the scripted path, but it can also be frustratingly game-breaking for some players.

At launch, some of The Sims 4 ’s DLC has been full of game-halting bugs. The My Wedding Stories Game Pack was released in February 2023 and remains one of the most controversial packs due to its buggy and unusable content that should have otherwise enhanced a critical part of a Sim’s life: marriage. These issues were only exacerbated by the presence of other DLC packs, which affected both the new download and the old ones. So, some fans are definitely bracing for glitchy impact when Enchanted by Nature downloads on July 10.

The Ugly: Sims 4 Modders and Mod Fans Beware

Anyone who plays The Sims 4 with mods has likely experienced this before: a new update is released, and suddenly, all mods are disabled. Turning mods back on is only one restart away, until dread settles in upon the realization that some mods may no longer be compatible with the current version of the game. When booting up a save file, things may truly take a turn for the worse: outfits may disappear, entire bodies may be full of unsightly question marks, and script mods are simply unusable—resulting in a gaming experience that is dangling by a thread. Even the best mods for The Sims 4 , which are usually incredibly popular across the fandom, may require some attention. In the worst-case scenarios, some mods haven't been, and will not be, updated to withstand the brunt of new content.

The tragedy of this truth is that these circumstances are not exclusive to those who have pre-ordered or purchased new content on launch day. These issues will impact all players using mods, regardless of whether they have purchased Enchanted by Nature, because the game will require a launch day update. This leaves many fans on the brink of despair at the announcement of a new Expansion, Game, or Stuff pack. Since the game is over a decade old, many players have been installing mods for The Sims 4 and collecting content for years. The desire to keep enjoying these enhancements becomes a source of anxiety whenever new content is teased, knowing that upcoming updates can disrupt carefully crafted game worlds. This cycle can lead to a sense of despair within the community, especially as new announcements emerge, reminding players of the potential for disruption rather than excitement for new additions.

item.title: Helldivers 2 Makes Requested Update to Super Citizen Edition
item.description:
Arrowhead Game Studios has revealed an update to the Super Citizen Edition of Helldivers 2 and its equivalent upgrade is coming on August 26, replacing the Steeled Veterans Warbond with a Warbond Token redeemable for any Premium Warbond. The token is being introduced in response to community feedback regarding an issue where Helldivers 2 players who purchased the Steeled Veterans Warbond – either through in-game purchases or with the Super Citizen Edition upgrade – could accidentally buy the Warbond a second time.

Warbonds are similar to traditional battle passes in that they're tiered reward systems that grant access to additional content, including new equipment, cosmetic items, emotes, and in-game currency. Unlike typical battle passes, Warbonds are not timed, allowing players to progress through its tiers at their own pace. Players can unlock Premium Warbonds by purchasing in-game currency – Super Credits – with real money, or by farming free Super Credits in Helldivers 2 .

The August 26 update will introduce the Warbond Token as a third option for purchasing Premium Warbonds, replacing the Steeled Veterans Warbond in the Super Citizen Edition and its equivalent upgrade. According to a post from Arrowhead Game Studios Social Media and Community Manager Katherin Baskin, players who purchase or already own the Super Citizen Edition or upgrade will receive the new Warbond Token after logging in to Helldivers 2 for the first time and accessing the shiphub. After players confirm the Warbond Token is in their inventory, all unpurchased Premium Warbonds for Helldivers 2 will have an option to "Claim Premium Warbond" rather than the usual "Buy Premium Warbond" option.

A New Token Will Unlock Any Helldivers 2 Premium Warbond

At the time of this writing, there are no plans to make the Warbond Token a purchasable in-game currency for Helldivers 2 ; the only way to receive the new currency is to buy the Super Citizen Edition Upgrade. The upcoming change is yet another example of Arrowhead Game Studios' commitment to supporting Helldivers 2 while considering player feedback. Most recently, the June 24 update for Helldivers 2 brought fixes for a number of weapon bugs, including an issue with mounted weapons reported by players that prevented them from shooting after using healing stims.

For new players jumping in with the Helldivers 2: Super Citizen Edition , or veteran Helldivers who decide to purchase the upgrade, choosing which Warbond to spend their precious Warbond Token on might prove to be a daunting task. With each Warbond offering unique cosmetics and gear with specific tactical benefits, deciding which Helldivers 2 Warbonds are worth it, whether that's a Warbond Token or Super Credits, it would be wise to consider the rewards each Warbond unlocks before redeeming either currency. Regardless, what the Warbond Token offers players is additional freedom, and that's what Helldivers 2 is all about.

item.title: 'Chance To Discover New Aspects Of Marvel' Marvel Rivals Game Director Teases Future Character Additions
item.description:
Marvel Rivals already features several of Marvel Comics' more obscure characters, like Jeff the Shark and Squirrel Girl, but NetEase hints that more strange heroes and villains could be on the way down the road. For now, Season 3 of Marvel Rivals is starting on July 11 and will add the highly anticipated vampire hunter Blade, as well as the freshly revealed Phoenix to the game's ever-growing roster.

Perhaps one of the biggest Marvel Rivals changes is its seasons being shortened to two months, down from three, starting with this upcoming third season. Each season of Marvel Rivals adds two new playable characters, except for Season 1, which added all members of The Fantastic Four. The first character is added at the start of each major update, with the second joining halfway through. With two-month-long seasons at play, this means that a new character is expected to join Marvel Rivals ' roster every month. Luckily, NetEase is working with one of the richest wells of comic characters ever in Marvel and won't be running out of ideas anytime soon.

When speaking with VideoGamer, Marvel Rivals director Guangyun Chen expressed the freedom NetEase has been given to license any Marvel hero or villain it wants for its popular third-person hero shooter. Chen mentioned Marvel Comics' long and rich 85-year history and the team's desire to bring in more off-the-wall characters like Squirrel Girl and Jeff the Shark to the game.

Marvel Rivals Can Add Any Hero or Villain From Marvel Comics

NetEase didn't hesitate when it came to adding Marvel's most popular heroes ever at launch, like Spider-Man and Wolverine, and there will likely be other massive names to come. However, it will be interesting to see what other strange, relatively lesser-known characters stumble their way onto Marvel Rivals ' roster. Characters like Howard the Duck, Beta Ray Bill, and Hellcow come to mind. Perhaps even Toad from the X-Men's orbit is on the table. It's good to know that NetEase has the entire Marvel Comics Universe to pull from, but the real challenge is going to be creating unique and impactful ability kits for each of these characters that stand apart from the rest. While Chen's comments are exciting, NetEase may avoid adding characters like Miles Morales or Rhodey for this very reason.

Season 3 of Marvel Rivals is set to begin on July 11, with Phoenix kicking things off as the newest playable character. It'll be Blade's time to shine just a few weeks later at the midseason point, around the beginning of August. Since the season revolves around Symbiote God Knull as the main villain, several heroes like Captain America and Jeff the Shark have been given sleek black Symbiote skins. Along with Spider-Man, Mister Fantastic, Invisible Woman, and The Thing's Future Foundation suits, there are plenty of fun and interesting cosmetics for Marvel fans to be excited about this upcoming season.
